name: Technical Writer (App Center)
description:
Semrush is a leading digital marketing toolkit for SEO, PPC, and content marketing professionals worldwide. Over 7 million marketers have already used Semrush to improve online marketing activities, track their website’s performance, and monitor their competition.

With over 45 tools within the software and search data for 140 countries, Semrush provides solutions for in-house marketing teams and agencies working with clients in any industry. Semrush is an absolute leader in helping good marketers become great!

In its niche and pricing segment, Semrush is an absolute leader in the number of tools available per one account and the richness of data. By ensuring the easy workflow between the marketing team members, Semrush helps them become front-runners in their industries.

About App Center

Semrush has launched and is further developing its own App Center that is aimed to become a go-to place to find best-in-class marketing solutions integrated within Semrush. The tools are developed by third-party vendors and by Semrush. Each app featured within our App Center is hand-picked by the Semrush team to ensure quality, reliability, and provide exclusive deals for our users.

We are currently looking for a Technical Writer to join our strong App Center Team. It is a new role for the project, and many processes will need to be built from scratch.

Responsibilities:

  • Plan, write and maintain technical docs for developers, such as App Center integration guides, how-tos, API documentation, etc.

  • Work closely with software engineers both inside and outside of Semrush to identify issues that can be addressed through better technical docs.

  • Ensure that documentation resolves roadblocks and improves the overall developer experience.

Most of the App Center docs will be written in markdown and built with a static site generator. You will encounter other solutions (Confluence, Swagger, etc.) depending on the project.

Requirements:

  • You have demonstrated experience writing technical docs for the developer audience.

  • You have excellent knowledge of English and know how to adjust your writing style for different audiences.

  • You are able to articulate, communicate, and defend your ideas.

  • You’re ready to learn new tools and technologies.

  • You’re comfortable working with ambiguity.

It would be great if you had experience working with Git and markup languages, but it’s not a must as we’re ready to teach you these things. Knowledge of some programming language would be a plus too.

We will ask all candidates to complete a test assignment. If you have some samples of technical docs for the developer audience that you’ve written in English, please send them along with your cover le

We offer:

  • Career in rapidly growing IT.

  • Official employment according to the Labor Code of the Russian Federation.

  • Flexible working day start (between 9am and noon) with 5 working days (Monday to Friday).

  • Friendly employees.

  • Corporate education (training, seminars, conferences).

  • Fitness compensation.

  • Medical insurance.
